turn.2: Differdange  Differdange ( , ) is a commune with town status in south-western Luxembourg, west from the country's capital.
turn.4: It lies near the borders with Belgium and France and it is located in the canton of Esch-sur-Alzette.
turn.5: What is the population of Differdange?
turn.6: With a population of around 26,000, Differdange is the country's third largest city.
turn.7: What cities are larger than Differdange?
turn.8: It is also the main town of the commune, and other towns within the commune include Lasauvage, Niederkorn, and Oberkorn.
turn.9: What is the economy of Differdange?
turn.10: Differdange is an industrial town that was home to much of Luxembourg's steel production, much of its development occurred during its heyday.
turn.11: Do many people work in Differdange?
turn.12: Today, Differdange still remains an important industrial center, with ArcelorMittal, the world's largest steel producer, retaining an important steel factory in the town.
